intro: Unona roxburghiana, commonly known as the Indian chestnut or wild chestnut, is a deciduous tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Betulaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The tree produces edible nuts enclosed in a spiny husk, which are harvested in the autumn. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and agroforestry systems.
